title: O2 and O3 equil - change in O3 amount Q vs K -calc

content.prompt:
3 O2(g) ⇄ 2 O3(g)      Kc = 1.8 × 10−56 at 570 K

 

For the system represented above, [O2] and [O3] initially are 0.131 mol/L and 0.789 mol/L respectively. Which of the following best predicts what will occur as the system approaches equilibrium at 570 K?

choices.label: The amount of O3(g) will increase, because Q < Kc.
The amount of O3(g) will decrease, because Q < Kc.
The amount of O3(g) will increase, because Q > Kc.
The amount of O3(g) will decrease, because Q > Kc.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
